Text: Built into the face of the cliff, you find a small alcove. The perfect place to stop and rest. The view from here is stunning - without trees obstructing the panorama, beyond the sheer drop of the cliff face on the opposite side of the road, the ocean stretches on as far as the eye can see.\n\nThe charred remains of an old campfire sits just outside the alcove; clearly you are not the first to have camped out here.
The scenery is quite beautiful. Most landscapes in the area are completely untouched by civilization, allowing nature's bounty to unfold to its fullest potential.
Nothing remotely interesting happens during your travel. The trek is long, but perhaps the change of pace is also nice in its own right.
The long path of packed dirt keeps going on and on, snaking over the occasional hill or under a canopy of trees.
The road runs mostly parallel to a huge, roaring river. While it's way too wide to cross even remotely safely, it adds quite a lot to the serene and calm feeling of your surroundings.

A road marker sits on the crossroads just outside town. The dirt path goes off to the east, leading to the dense forests and a slightly mountainous area, and also to the south, leading to the aptly named South Finmer.
